com.madisp.stupid

Interface Converter

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    DefaultConverter

    public interface Converter
    A Converter implements the type coercion rules for Stupid. For a default (and pretty stupid) implementation, see DefaultConverter.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean toBool(java.lang.Object value)
      Convert an object to a boolean.
      double toDouble(java.lang.Object value)
      Convert an object to a double.
      int toInt(java.lang.Object value)
      Convert an object to an integer.

      Convert an object to a string.

    • Method Detail

      • toBool

        boolean toBool(java.lang.Object value)
        Convert an object to a boolean.
        Parameters:
        value - object to convert, may be null
        Returns:
        boolean representation of the object

      • toInt

        int toInt(java.lang.Object value)
        Convert an object to an integer.
        Parameters:
        value - object to convert, may be null
        Returns:
        integer representation of given object

      • toDouble

        double toDouble(java.lang.Object value)
        Convert an object to a double.
        Parameters:
        value - object to convert, may be null
        Returns:
        the double representation of the argument

      • toString

        java.lang.String toString(java.lang.Object value)
        Convert an object to a string. Java already has semantics for converting (.toString()) but it is nice to still have it here anyway.
        Parameters:
        value - object to convert, may be null
        Returns:
        the argument represented as a String
